title: Pelicans, off to 2-10 start, fire Green as coach
content: The Pelicans have fired coach Willie Green after a 2-10 start to the season in which New Orleans became the first team in NBA history to lose three of its first six games by at least 30 points.

title: Sources: Virginia Tech in early talks with Franklin
content: Former Penn State coach James Franklin and Virginia Tech are in the early stages of talks, with some resolution on his candidacy expected in the coming days, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel.

title: Curry torches Spurs again, ties MJ with latest 40
content: Two days after he lit up the Spurs for 46 points, Warriors star Stephen Curry scored 49 to beat them Friday night, tying Michael Jordan's record for most 40-point games after turning 30 in the process.

title: After 6 ejected, WVU women upset No. 15 Duke
content: Down to just five players after six Mountaineers were ejected before the half, West Virginia managed to grind out a 57-49 upset of No. 15 Duke.

title: Sources: UCLA QB Iamaleava out vs. Ohio State
content: UCLA quarterback Nico Iamaleava will not play against No. 1 Ohio State after he suffered a concussion last week against Nebraska, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: Wisconsin turns to freshman QB vs. IU
content: Wisconsin will start true freshman Carter Smith at No. 2 Indiana, sources told ESPN, replacing Danny O'Neil after the sophomore was carted off the field with a right leg injury last week.

title: Shiffrin dominates slalom for career win 102
content: Mikaela Shiffrin opened the Olympic slalom season in convincing style by dominating a World Cup race in Finnish Lapland for her record-extending 102nd career win.

title: 'Last Chance U' coach Beam dies after being shot
content: College football coach John Beam, who was featured in the Netflix series "Last Chance U," has died after being shot, the Oakland Police Department said.

title: üçå Bradley Jr. No. 1 pick in Banana Ball draft
content: The Indianapolis Clowns selected Bradley at No. 1 as part of the inaugural Banana Ball draft Thursday night.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Finding the value on the talent-rich UFC 322 card
content: Two pairs of pound-for-pound fighters square off in title fights. MMA experts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Ready for NFL Week 11? We have sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Big game coming for Aaron Rodgers? Matchup questions for the Seahawks and Rams? An edge for Jared Goff against the Eagles? Catch up on Week 11.

title: Real or not real: Another perfect UConn season? UCLA's best team ever?
content: Can Azzi Fudd & Co. run the table? Is this Dawn Staley's best South Carolina backcourt? Let's debate.

title: Looking for the next Cignetti? Start with these traits and coaches
content: If any of the nine open Power 4 jobs want to replicate Indiana's success, here are the steps they could take.

title: Will Tigers trade Skubal? What we learned about all 30 teams at the MLB GM meetings
content: From Tarik Skubal's status to the future of the Phillies' core, here are the top offseason priorities straight from every front office.

title: Lucky or unlucky: How have Premier League teams fared this season?
content: Which Premier League teams have ridden their luck, and which have been unlucky over injuries, VAR and managerial changes this season?

title: How Roldan went from USMNT afterthought to Pochettino favorite
content: A few months ago, Cristian Roldan believed his USMNT career was drifting away. Now he could be in line for a key role under Mauricio Pochettino.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want to sign Wolves' Jo√£o Gomes
content: Wolverhampton Wanderers midfielder Jo√£o Gomes is a target for Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: The key to Zilisch becoming NASCAR's next big star
content: The NASCAR Cup Series isn't kind to rookies, no matter how highly touted, but that may not apply to Connor Zilisch when he steps up in 2026.

title: Huge Row Over Farooq Abdullah's 'Hope No Op Sindoor' Comment
content: Former Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Farooq Abdullah has made two controversial comments in just one day. The first was linked to the module of white collar terrorists - they were doctors - that the police demolished in Haryana.

title: 10th-Pass Watches Videos, Reads And Becomes 'Counterfeiting Expert'. Arrested
content: In an operation straight out of a crime thriller, police in Bhopal have busted what appears to be a full-fledged fake-currency factory being operated from a house by a 21-year-old man who trained himself by watching YouTube videos.

title: Japan Protests China's Travel Advisory Over Taiwan Intervention Remark
content: Japan raised objections Saturday after China advised its citizens to avoid visiting Japan, as a feud over the new Japanese leader's remarks on Taiwan showed no signs of dying down.

title: 60-Year-Old Woman Mauled By Bear At Tea Estate In Tamil Nadu
content: A 60-year old woman worker was mauled by a bear at a tea estate in Kothagiri on Saturday, and she was admitted to a government hospital for treatment, officials said.

title: Ram Mohan Roy A "British Agent": Madhya Pradesh Education Minister's Shocker
content: Madhya Pradesh's Higher Education Minister, Inder Singh Parmar, has triggered a political storm after he made remarks linking 19th-century social reformer Raja Ram Mohan Roy to British interests.

title: Class 6 Girl Forced To Do 100 Sit-Ups For Being Late To School, Dies
content: On Children's Day - a celebration when schools shower students with extra care and kindness - a 12-year-old student in Maharashtra died after being given corporal punishment by her teacher for reaching school just ten minutes late.

title: As Nitish Kumar Eyes 10th Term, A Look At Longest-Serving Chief Ministers
content: With the National Democratic Alliance achieving a decisive victory in the Bihar Assembly elections, Janata Dal (United) leader and the state's longest-serving Chief Minister, Nitish Kumar, is poised to take office for another term.

title: Desperate To Get Married, 4 Women Trample 16-Day-Old Nephew To Death
content: In what appears to be a ritualistic murder, four women trampled their 16-day-old nephew to death with their feet in Rajasthan's Jodhpur because they believed that it would help them finally get married.

title: "So Egregious": Trump To Sue BBC For Up To $5 Billion Over Video Edit
content: Donald Trump announced Friday that he intends to take the BBC to court, seeking as much as $5 billion in damages after the UK broadcaster apologised for a misleadingly edited segment of one of his speeches but refused to provide compensation.

title: 2 Cases Filed Against Al-Falah University For Forgery, Cheating
content: Delhi Police has registered two separate FIRs against Haryana's Al-Falah University, following red flags raised by the University Grants Commission (UGC) and the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC), an official said on Saturday.

title: Prashant Kishor, Mayawati, A Owaisi: Small Players' Big Impact On Bihar Polls
content: The Bihar Assembly elections have delivered a verdict reminiscent of the NDA's big victory in 2010, but with new political dynamics.

title: Prashant Kishor And The Tale Of Two Predictions
content: Prashant Kishor, whose own party was making a poll debut in Bihar, failed to live up to the hype. The Nitish Kumar-led Janata Dal (United) won 3 times the number of seats predicted by the former poll strategist.

title: Timeline Of Entire Probe Into White Collar Terrorists Behind Delhi Blast
content: A snapshot of the entire investigation into the white collar terror module which was busted before they could do any major harm simultaneously has been collated from various sources who spoke to NDTV.

title: School Teacher Gets Life Term For Raping Girl, 10, In Kerala
content: A court on Saturday sentenced a school teacher, who was also a BJP activist, to life imprisonment for raping a 10-year-old girl at Palathayi here.

title: Sharad Pawar Says Cash Transfer Scheme Swayed Bihar Voters, BJP Hits Back
content: Sharad Pawar has alleged that the BJP-led NDA's victory in the recent Bihar Assembly election was influenced by a government-backed cash transfer scheme, under which Rs 10,000 was credited into the bank accounts of women voters shortly before polling

title: New Photograph Shows Delhi Suicide Bomber Umar Mohammad In Doctor's Attire
content: Umar Mohammad, the terrorist who carried out a suicide car bomb attack near Delhi's Red Fort, was seen on CCTV in a doctor's attire.

title: Delhi Blast Suspects Used 'Dead Drop' Emails To Communicate: Sources
content: The terror suspects being probed in connection with the 10/11 Delhi blast used a special method called 'dead drop' emails to communicate, sources said. This is how the arrested doctors, the investigators believe, planned their terror activities.

title: "Disowning Family, Quitting Politics": Tejashwi Yadav's Sister After RJD Rout
content: Dropping a bombshell a day after the RJD suffered a devastating loss in the Bihar Assembly elections, party chief Lalu Yadav's daughter Rohini Acharya has said she is disowning her family and quitting politics.

title: Adani Ahmedabad Marathon Unveils Official Jersey At Palladium Mall Ahead Of 9th Edition
content: The official jersey for the 9th Adani Ahmedabad Marathon was revealed at Palladium Mall on Saturday, in front of fitness enthusiasts and local runners.

title: Union Health Minister JP Nadda Launches 10 New AMRIT pharmacies
content: The Union government on Saturday launched 10 new AMRIT (Affordable Medicines and Reliable Implants for Treatment) pharmacies to increase access to affordable medicines and strengthen healthcare in the country.

title: 'Abused & hit': After disowning Lalu family, Rohini's big charge on Tejashwi Yadav
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter, Rohini Acharya, alleges she was expelled from her family by brother Tejashwi Yadav and aides Sanjay Yadav and Rameez. Acharya claims she faced abuse and physical assault after questioning their roles in the RJD's Bihar election defeat. She stated they disowned her when she sought accountability for the party's failure.

title: Make America Grate Again: Trump vs MTG in epic MAGA maelstrom after she tries to maim H1b visas
content: Donald Trump publicly attacked Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene, calling her "wacky" and accusing her of moving left. Greene retaliated, suggesting her push to release Epstein files and opposition to H1B visas angered Trump. This public spat highlights growing divisions within the MAGA movement, with Greene defiant and Trump threatening political repercussions.

title: IPL 2026 Retention: Retained and released players with purse remaining for all IPL teams - full list
content: KKR and CSK will headline the bidding wars at the IPL 2026 mini-auction on December 16 in Abu Dhabi, with the biggest purses in hand. KKR, armed with Rs 63.4 crore after releasing high-value names including Venkatesh Iyer and Andre Russell, aim for a major squad overhaul. CSK, having freed up Rs 40 crore, are set to rebuild their bowling department and could chase Pathirana or Stokes. A busy trading window saw marquee moves like Ravindra Jadeja to RR, Sanju Samson to CSK, and Mohammed Shami to LSG, adding further intrigue to the auction pool. All released players will now enter the mini-auction pool.

title: Election results: Bihar's political map has been redrawn ‚Äî and BJP now sits at its centre
content: Bihar's political landscape has dramatically shifted as the BJP, once an outsider, has emerged as the dominant force, securing its highest-ever assembly seats.  This rise, built over decades through patient groundwork and social engineering, has redefined the state's power dynamics, potentially eclipsing Nitish Kumar's long-held influence and signaling a new era of BJP-led governance.

title: Mark Zuckerberg's charity insight: Researchers demanding GPUs; reject space and staff
content: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan's philanthropic organisation, CZI, is now prioritising computing power, specifically GPUs, over physical expansion for its science and AI mission.  Researchers at Biohub are demanding more GPUs, which Chan describes as 'new lab space' that is more expensive than traditional facilities. This strategic shift aims to accelerate breakthroughs in AI-powered biology.

title: 'RIP Test cricket': Ex-IND player's furious take; triggers debate on Eden Gardens surface
content: Eden Gardens' pitch drew sharp criticism during the India-South Africa Test, with many deeming it unsuitable for the format.  Former cricketers like Harbhajan Singh and Michael Vaughan expressed dismay. However, Ravichandran Ashwin defended the surface, attributing batting struggles to technique rather than conditions, highlighting Temba Bavuma's resilience. South Africa were reduced to 93/7 by stumps on Day 2 in their second innings.

title: Shubman Gill fitness update: India Test captain taken to hospital for scans
content: If required, Shubman Gill could stay under observation overnight, but all of that depends on the scan reports. The Indian cricket board confirmed that he had a neck spasm. Gill lasted just three deliveries in the middle, as he experienced severe pain moments after hitting a boundary and was immediately off the field.

title: H-1B visa row: Donald Trump withdraws support for long term ally; says ‚Äògone Far Left‚Äô
content: Donald Trump has withdrawn his endorsement of Marjorie Taylor Greene, citing her constant complaints and perceived shift to the "Far Left." Trump's decision follows Greene's announcement of a bill to ban H-1B visas, which she claims will create more jobs and housing for Americans. Trump also criticized her appearance on "The View."

title: 'Crazy fearmongering': Indian-Malaysian CEO stopped by FBI agents at Miami airport
content: Vishen Lakhiani, an Indian-Malaysian CEO on an O-1 visa, was questioned by FBI agents upon arriving in Miami. He was asked about his international travel and social media presence. Lakhiani expressed concern over xenophobia and fearmongering impacting tourism and foreign student applications in the US. The O-1 visa holder said he can't wait for the next US election.

title: 'Taught to over-deliver,' says Andrew McCaskill: what professionals must learn
content: LinkedIn expert Andrew McCaskill warns that many U.S. employees become ‚Äúaccidentally indispensable‚Äù by over-delivering, helping colleagues, and taking on extra work without recognition. His advice is to seek clarity, set boundaries, and document contributions. By using strategies like the ‚ÄúYes, and‚Ä¶‚Äù approach and pushing back thoughtfully, professionals can protect their well-being while turning their importance into career growth.

title: GM to suppliers: Find alternatives to China; America‚Äôs largest carmaker sets deadline
content: General Motors is directing thousands of suppliers to remove China-sourced parts and raw materials from their supply chains, aiming for complete divestment by 2027. This move, intensified by deepening U.S.-China trade hostilities and President Trump's policies, seeks to enhance supply chain resiliency. Carmakers are accelerating efforts to unwind decades-old sourcing ties due to ongoing geopolitical and economic wrangling.

title: Crisis brewing? How Pak is dismantaling its judiciary - and giving more power to Munir
content: Pakistan's judiciary faces a crisis as senior judges resign following a controversial constitutional amendment. This change centralizes power, creating a new Federal Constitutional Court and elevating the army chief to Chief of Defence Forces with extended tenure. Critics decry the move as an attack on judicial independence and civilian oversight, potentially impacting ongoing legal cases.

title: Marissa Van Noy thanks Ravens for supporting families during high-pressure weeks
content: Kyle Van Noy‚Äôs wife Marissa went viral after thanking the Baltimore Ravens for hosting a Women‚Äôs Luncheon during a high pressure week. Her Instagram post showed rare behind the scenes moments, a simple caption, and the timing that made fans pay attention as the Ravens prepared for the Cleveland Browns and evaluated their Week 10 win.

title: Camille Kostek supports Rob Gronkowski as he reflects on following Tom Brady
content: Rob Gronkowski officially retired as a Patriot, signing a one-day contract to conclude his illustrious career. His partner, Camille Kostek, celebrated the emotional homecoming on Instagram with a heartfelt tribute. The post featured cherished moments, including a photo with owner Robert Kraft and a special appearance by their French bulldog, Ralphie, sporting a Patriots jersey.

title: Track Queen Anna Hall stuns fans with surprise engagement to NFL star Darius Slayton
content: World champion heptathlete Anna Hall announced her engagement to NFL wide receiver Darius Slayton on Instagram. The proposal took place on the track where they first met, with fellow athletes and fans sending warm congratulations. Hall is currently enjoying a successful season, having recently won gold at the Tokyo World Championships.

title: Candace Owens lists 10 TPUSA lies, questions Charlie Kirk assassination story
content: Candace Owens has revealed ten alleged lies spread by Turning Point USA following Charlie Kirk's assassination. Owens claims TPUSA fabricated stories to portray individuals as more heroic and loyal, altering facts about Kirk, his beliefs, and the incident. She vows to continue investigating, believing she is close to uncovering the truth.

title: Delhi car blast: Cops uncover 'deeper conspiracy'; doctor module used ‚Äòspycraft‚Äô tactics
content: Delhi Police has filed a new FIR to investigate a deeper conspiracy behind the car blast near Red Fort. This follows an earlier FIR transferred to the NIA. The special cell is invoking criminal conspiracy charges and anticipates making arrests shortly. Intelligence sources noted the blast's intensity from new CCTV footage.

title: Who are Sanjay Yadav & Rameez? 'Forced' Lalu Yadav 's daughter Rohini Acharya to quit politics
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter, Rohini Acharya, announced she is "disowning" her family and quitting politics in a social media post. She blamed aides Sanjay Yadav and Rameez for her actions, stating they asked her to do so and she is taking the blame after the RJD's election defeat.

title: Gronk‚Äôs one-day Patriots contract sparks debate: Will he get a Super Bowl ring?
content: Rob Gronkowski signed a one-day contract to retire as a Patriot, but his surprise exchange with Robert Kraft has sparked a real question. If New England makes a Super Bowl run, could Gronk actually receive a ring? Here‚Äôs the factual breakdown of his contract, league rules, and why the final decision falls entirely on Kraft.

title: '2 ball idhar se, please': Pant‚Äôs quick suggestion hands Kuldeep instant wicket - watch
content: Rishabh Pant stepped up as captain, guiding India's bowlers effectively after Shubman Gill's injury. India's disciplined bowling attack, spearheaded by Ravindra Jadeja's four wickets, reduced South Africa to 93 for 7, protecting a slender lead. A crucial wicket came from Pant's tactical suggestion to Kuldeep Yadav, showcasing his sharp instincts.

title: Seth Jarvis injury update: Svechnikov high stick sidelines Hurricanes forward
content: Carolina Hurricanes forward Seth Jarvis suffered an upper-body injury after a high stick from a teammate. The 23-year-old, a key offensive player with 10 goals this season, left Friday's game and did not return. His absence raises concerns about the team's scoring depth and line rotations as they await updates on his condition.

title: 5 common medicines that can damage kidneys and what are the alternatives
content: Millions in India face chronic kidney disease, with drug-induced damage a significant concern. Common medications like NSAIDs, antibiotics, and contrast agents can harm kidneys, especially with long-term use or in vulnerable individuals. Understanding these risks and consulting doctors is crucial for prevention.

title: 'Quitting politics': Rohini Acharya 'disowns' Lalu family day after RJD's Bihar poll debacle
content: Following a significant electoral setback for the Mahagathbandhan, Lalu Prasad's daughter, Rohini Acharya, announced her departure from politics and disowned her family. She claimed this decision was prompted by Sanjay Yadav and Rameez, taking full responsibility for the outcome. Acharya's statement on X has sparked considerable discussion regarding the party's future direction.

title: IPL 2026 | RCB full list of retentions, released players; remaining purse for champs
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru, fresh off their maiden IPL title in 2025, are gearing up for the 2026 season with a reinforced core.  Their championship run showcased a shift towards collective effort over individual brilliance.  The team now focuses on building upon this successful foundation, retaining key players and integrating promising young talent for another strong campaign.

title: Delhi blast: 2 FIRs against Al-Falah University; accreditation violations flagged
content: Delhi Crime Branch has registered two FIRs against Al-Falah University for cheating and forgery, following serious irregularities flagged by UGC and NAAC. The university is also under scrutiny after three doctors from its medical faculty were arrested in connection with a terror module linked to banned outfits.

title: 'Exit polls undermined LJP(RV)': Chirag dismisses rift rumours with JD(U); flays surveys
content: Chirag Paswan, LJP(RV) chief, refuted claims of discord between his party and Nitish Kumar's JD(U) during the Bihar elections, calling it a 'false narrative'. He highlighted his party's strong performance, exceeding exit poll predictions, and praised Nitish Kumar's determined campaigning. Paswan also criticized the opposition's language and their post-result blame game, emphasizing NDA's unity and commitment to Bihar's aspirations.

title: 'Part of India‚Äôs consciousness': PM Modi assures welfare of tribal community
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted the significant contributions of tribal communities to India's independence movement, criticizing past Congress governments for neglecting their welfare and contributions. He emphasized his administration's commitment to tribal development, including healthcare, education, and sports, and the recognition of tribal heroes like Bhagwan Birsa Munda.

title: IND vs SA | Jadeja dismantles visitors with four-for; Proteas reduced to 93/7 at stumps
content: Ravindra Jadeja's exceptional spell has put South Africa in a precarious position, ending Day 2 at 93/7 and leading by just 63 runs. India had earlier been bowled out for 189, with Marco Jansen and Simon Harmer taking seven wickets between them. Jadeja's 4/29, supported by Kuldeep Yadav's 2/12, has India firmly in control.

title: Delhi car blast probe: New CCTV footage shows 'bomber' Umar at Faridabad shop; had 2 phones
content: New CCTV footage from Faridabad shows Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorist Umar Mohammed using multiple phones before the Red Fort blast. Security forces demolished his family home in Pulwama as part of a crackdown on terror modules procuring vehicles and chemicals. Authorities also attached the home of a separatist leader suspected to be in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: India second largest importer of Russian crude oil in October
content: Despite US objections, India continues to be a major buyer of Russian crude oil, ranking second globally in October with $2.5 billion in purchases. This trend persists as Western nations urge limitations on imports financing Russia's war in Ukraine. China remains the top buyer of Russian fossil fuels overall.

title: MI to LSG! Arjun Tendulkar bids farewell to Mumbai Indians; Sara Tendulkar's emotional message grabs attention
content: Arjun Tendulkar has been traded from Mumbai Indians to Lucknow Super Giants for IPL 2026 at his existing price of Rs 30 lakh.  He expressed his excitement to join LSG.  Meanwhile, Mumbai Indians have reacquired leg-spinner Mayank Markande from Kolkata Knight Riders, marking his return to his former franchise.

title: Chinese SUV tries Range Rover‚Äôs viral stunt: Watch Epic fail!
content: It offers 225 mm of ground clearance, approach and departure angles of 22¬∞ and 30¬∞, a suite of terrain programs, 21-inch wheels, and even a tank-turn feature, equipment clearly intended to position it alongside established off-road nameplates.

title: 'Ups and downs inevitable': RJD's first reaction after Bihar defeat; calls itself 'party of poor'
content: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) has reacted to its significant defeat in the Bihar assembly elections, stating it is not despondent despite a crushing loss to the ruling NDA. The party emphasized that public service is an ongoing journey with inevitable ups and downs, vowing to continue raising the voice of the poor.

title: 'I commend Mohsin Naqvi': Shehbaz Sharif congratulates Pakistan team; gets trolled
content: Babar Azam's unbeaten 102 guided Pakistan to an eight-wicket victory over Sri Lanka, securing the ODI series 2-0. The win drew praise from Pakistan's Prime Minister, but drew a critical response from former Indian cricketer Aakash Chopra regarding the significance of the bilateral series win.

title: Trump‚Äôs tariffs cut US toy orders by 50%; how are Indian exporters fighting back
content: Indian toy exporters face a significant slowdown as US buyers divert orders to other nations following a 50% tariff imposition. Despite a strong start to the financial year, new orders for the upcoming festive season have plummeted by half.

title: 'Explosive samples were being forwarded‚Ä¶': Govt calls Nowgam blast accidental ‚Äî what MHA said
content: An accidental explosion at Nowgam Police Station in Srinagar killed nine people and injured 27 others. The blast occurred while processing a large cache of explosive substances and chemicals recovered during a terror module investigation. The ministry of home affairs has ruled out any terror angle, attributing the incident to the unstable nature of the seized materials.

title: Infosys hands out Sept quarter bonus: Employees to get 75% average bonus; check details
content: Infosys has announced performance-linked payouts for the September quarter, with employees receiving an average bonus of 75% of their eligible amount. This figure is slightly lower than the previous quarter's average of 80%. Payouts varied by job level and performance rating, with bonuses ranging from 70.5% to 83% and will be added to November salaries.

title: Maithili Thakur becomes youngest Bihar MLA after Sa Re Ga Ma Pa & Indian Idol rejections
content: Maithili Thakur, a 25-year-old BJP candidate, made a historic win in Bihar's Alinagar constituency. Despite early rejections in singing reality shows, her breakthrough on 'Rising Star' propelled her career. She is now celebrated for her political debut and dedication to Mithila culture.

title: Raja Ram Mohan Roy was a ‚ÄòBritish agent‚Äô aiding religious conversions, claims M.P. Minister
content: At an event to mark anniversary of tribal leader Birsa Munda, Higher Education Minister Inder Singh Parmar says the tribal icon had tried to stop the ‚Äòcycle of religious conversion run by some fake social reformers‚Äô at the behest of the British rulers

title: Officials told to increase number of free buses in Tirumala
content: TTD Executive Officer directs officials to speed up the construction process of TTD temples in several States during a review meeting

title: ECI plans for pre-mapped data during SIR Phase 2 remain unclear
content: While poll panel hopes to use pre-mapping exercise to match names in old SIR lists with the current electoral roll, officers across several States pass on the buck to the electors

title: ED arrests OSBPL MD on money laundering charges, sent to 14-day custody
content: The probe agency conducted searches at nine locations in and around Delhi and other places, following which it arrested Swaraj Singh Yadav, the MD of Ocean Seven Buildtech Private Limited (OSBPL)

title: Health Minister¬†inaugurates 10 new AMRIT outlets across India
content: AMRIT pharmacies have been providing life-saving and essential medicines at discounts ranging from 50% to 90%

title: Revanth gets pat from Rahul Gandhi and Kharge for victory in Jubilee Hills
content: Rahul Gandhi tells State Congress leaders to strengthen the party further, and says the party has a huge responsibility on its shoulders for taking all sections of the society along with it

title: Equal representation drive demands action, not excuses, from Kerala‚Äôs political leadership
content: State convention of Thulya Pradinithya Prasthanam organised at the Kerala Sahitya Akademi Hall in Thrissur

title: RSS worker found hanging
content: WhatsApp message purportedly written by Anand K. Thampi before his death mentions denial of ticket as a reason for ‚Äúending life‚Äù

title: Congress unveils ‚Äòsurprise‚Äô candidate from Ravipuram division in Kochi
content: The party declared Antony Judy, who contested on Twenty20 ticket from Ernakulam in last year‚Äôs general elections, as its candidate

title: Auto workers stage protest demanding financial aid of ‚Çπ15,000
content: Under the Vahana Mitra scheme, ‚Çπ15,000 was given to only 2,90,000 drivers, while remaining 5,53,659 auto and cab drivers have been left out, alleges IFTU Auto Workers‚Äô Union president

title: Government medical officer among six arrested in Madanapalle kidney racket case
content: The racket is run by a 15-member team headed by Dr. Anjaneyulu, the hospital owner and Annamayya District Coordinator of Health Services (DCHS), says Deputy SP

title: Polling station-wise special drives under consideration in SIR exercise
content: Such drives can be considered for people who have not received enumeration forms or failed to return them on time, says Kelkar

title: Hindupur YSRCP office ransacked over ‚Äòremarks‚Äô against Balakrishna
content: Local YSRCP leader alleges that the people of Hindupur have been ‚Äúliving like slaves for the last 40 years under someone sitting in Hyderabad,‚Äù while taking a veiled dig at Balakrishna, reportedly triggering the TDP cadre and the actor‚Äôs followers

title: Nine arrested for drug peddling, over 23 kg ganja seized in Kadapa
content: RIMS police also seize 1,620 Tapedac 100 mg tablets worth nearly ‚Çπ1 lakh and two mobile phones from the accused

title: Back-to-back exits haunt the Congress in Thrissur
content: Two district-level leaders quit the party, unhappy with denial of party ticket in the local body election. Another leader resigns from all party positions

title: HC: Naming politicians as heads of govt.-run companies detrimental to public interest
content: It says the government must appoint only qualified persons with sound domain knowledge and professional excellence

title: Urban bodies in Ernakulam lag behind in SIR fieldworks as BLOs struggle to trace voters
content: While enumeration forms have been handed over to most voters in 11 of the 14 Assembly constituencies in the district, three segments ‚ÄîThripunithura, Ernakulam, and Thrikkakara‚Äîhave been lagging behind; only about 70% of voters in these segments have received forms, while most others have crossed the 80% mark

title: Tamil Nadu parties spar over South Korean firm‚Äôs investment plan in A.P.
content: The BJP and the ruling DMK got into a verbal exchange on social media over a South Korean company announcing its plans to invest in A.P. The same firm had earlier held negotiations with the Tamil Nadu government to invest there

title: Centre targets awarding 10,000 km of NH projects in FY 2026
content: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways expects fresh approvals to reach 10,000 km in the current financial year, which had dropped to 7,500 km in financial year 2024, and 6,000 km in financial year 2025

title: Rift in NDA averted as BDJS allotted 13 seats in Kochi Corporation
content: The BDJS, which had stayed away when the initial list was announced earlier this week, was represented by its State general secretary and district president Sujith at the release of the second list

title: Delhi blast: Police registers two FIRs against Al-Falah University for forgery and cheating
content: Officials said the action was initiated after both the UGC and NAAC flagged ‚Äúmajor irregularities‚Äù during their review of the institution‚Äôs functioning, prompting law enforcement agencies to step in

title: Woman, partner arrested for allegedly assaulting minor son in Kochi
content: The alleged incident occurred on November 13, 2025,, when the boy, who usually slept with his mother, was asked to move to another bedroom, which he refused, following which the woman‚Äôs partner reportedly assaulted him

title: R.K. Singh resigns from BJP following suspension from party
content: Joining the BJP in 2023, the former IAS officer was repeatedly¬†attacking BJP leaders during the Assembly election and even accused the Nitish Kumar government of a ‚Çπ62,000 crore power scam in Bihar

title: Andhra Pradesh aims for $2.40-trillion economy by 2047, says Naidu
content: State, buoyed by its young population, is poised to reach a $42,000 per capita income, the Chief Minister tells the CII Partnership Summit, as partners from New Zealand, Australia and Germany praise the State‚Äôs progress

title: Lobbying for libraries in Tamil Nadu
content: In Tamil Nadu, State-level surveys assessing the learning outcomes of children have noted a decline in proficiency levels in English. While reading for pleasure has taken a backseat among children in the State, the lack of adequate incentives and infrastructure to encourage reading remains a significant setback, finds Meghna M.

title: J&K CM promises compensation for buildings damaged by accidental blast in Srinagar
content: Nine people were killed and 32 others were injured in the explosion, which severely damaged the police station building and affected the nearby structures

title: Bihar result is unbelievable for us, no political party in India‚Äôs history has managed a 90% strike rate, says Congress
content: The 2025 Bihar election result, where the Congress managed a barely 10% strike rate by winning six out of the 61 seats it contested, is its second worst performance since 2010, when it had won only four seats

title: NWSL semifinals preview: Which recent champs will advance to the final?
content: the four most recent NWSL champions are also the 2025 semifinalists . Gotham defeated the no. 1-seeded Kansas City Current 2-1 in extra time . the Spirit, champions in 2021, lost last year's final to Orlando .

title: NFL: Chiefs road favorites at Broncos, Seahawks slight 'dogs at Rams
content: the red-hot new England Patriots beat their division rival New York Jets on "Thursday Night Football" the Miami Dolphins are favored by 2.5 against the Washington Commanders in Madrid, Spain . the rest of the day features a plethora of marquee matchups, including the underdog Tampa Bay Buccaneers .

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 11

title: Area 51, an alien and the most fearsome young duo in the NBA
content: stepon CASTLE screamed, streaking down the floor with 8:28 left in the second quarter of the San Antonio Spurs . "RIM, VIC!" was a turning point in tv's season-opening win in Dallas . a whistle quickly pierced the noisy celebration as Dallas called a timeout to regroup .

title: NBA execs, scouts on Mavs' spiral and five more early-season trends
content: there weren't many people believing GM Nico Harrison should have remained as Mavs general manager . we decided to ask league executives and scouts if they're believing in some of the most impactful early-season trends across the NBA . the crater that is the Mavericks franchise before moving on to hot starts for the lakers .

title: Mbapp√© too focused on another French World Cup triumph to dwell on 400 goals
content: francais beat Ukraine 4-0 in the 2026 world cup on friday night . three players were missing from the 26-man squad . manu Kon√© is suspended for the game and went back to his club, AS Roma . he scored two goals and one assist for his side .

title: Lions players tell their favorite Dan Campbell stories
content: first-year offensive coordinator was given the tall order of following previous coordinator Ben Johnson in the role . he helped turn the Lions into one of the NFL's top offenses over his three years in charge . the game marked the third straight contest in which Detroit had failed to score .
